title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

Other forms of the integrand in a definite integral, e.g., |  f ( x )−g ( x )  |, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4AE1@ |  g ( x )−f ( x )  |, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4AE1@ or g ( x )−f ( x ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@449D@ earn the first point.

To earn the second point, the response must have a lower limit of −2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaIYaaaaa@3AA5@ and an upper limit expressed as either the letter B with no value attached, or a number that is correct to the number of digits presented, with at least one and up to three decimal places.

· Case 1: If the response did not earn the second point because of an incorrect value of B, 0<B<1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DF0@ but used a lower limit of −2, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaIYaGaaiilaaaa@3B55@ the response earns the third point only for a consistent answer.

· Case 2: If the response did not earn the second point because the lower limit used was x=0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGimaiaacYcaaaa@3C69@ but the response used a correct upper limit of B the response earns the third point for a consistent answer of 0.708 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaiEdacaaIWaGaaGioaaaa@3CA5@ (or 0.707 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaGaaiOlaiaaiEdacaaIWaGaaG4naaaa@3CA4@ ).

· Case 3: If a response uses any other incorrect limits it does not earn the second or third points.

A response containing the integrand g ( x )−f ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43EE@ must interpret the value of the resulting integral correctly to earn the third point. For example, the following response earns all 3 points: ∫ − 2 B ( g ( x )−f ( x ) )  dx =−3.604 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@562A@ so the area is 3.604. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D55@ However, the response “ Area= ∫ − 2 B ( g ( x )−f ( x ) )  dx =3.604 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@59C8@ ” presents an untrue statement and earns the first and second points but not the third point.

A response must earn the first point in order to be eligible for the third point. If the response has earned the second point, then only the correct answer will earn the third point.

Instructions for scoring a response that presents an integrand of ln( x+3 )− x 4 +2 x 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4569@ :

· The first time a response implicitly presents f( x )−g(x) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD4@ as j( x )=ln( x+3 )− x 4 +2 x 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4779@ (with no explicit connection) in any part of this question, the response loses a point. The response is then eligible for all remaining points for a correct or consistent answer.

· In part (a) the consistent answer using j( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39A9@ is negative and will not earn the third point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The response need not present the value of h ′  ( − 0.5 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@426A@ The last line earns both points. However, if a value is presented it must be correct for the digits reported up to three decimal places.

A response that reports an incorrect value of h ′  ( − 0.5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41B8@ earns only the first point.

A response that presents only h ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E0C@ does not earn either point.

A response that compares the values of f ′ ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C79@ and g ′ ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C7A@ at x=− 0.5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA8@ earns the first point and is eligible for the second point. This comparison can be made symbolically or verbally; for example, the response “the rate of change of f ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DFE@ is less than the rate of change of g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DFF@ at x=− 0.5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FA8@ ” earns the first point.

Instructions for scoring a response that presents h(x) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3958@ as ln( x+3 )− x 4 +2 x 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4569@ :

· If the first time the response presents f( x )−g(x) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD4@ as j( x )=ln( x+3 )− x 4 +2 x 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4779@ occurs in part (b), the response loses a point. If the response already lost a point for this error in part (a), then the response is eligible for all remaining points for a correct or consistent answer.

· In part (b), the consistent answer using j( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39A9@ is that j ′  ( − 0.5 )=2.4>0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@475E@ so h is increasing at x=− 0.5. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@405A@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned for an integrand of k ( f ( x )−g ( x ) ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4750@ or its equivalent with k≠0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGRbGaeyiyIKRaaGimaaaa@3C6D@ in any definite integral. If k≠1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGRbGaeyiyIKRaaGymaiaacYcaaaa@3D1E@ then the response is not eligible for the second point.

A response that does not earn the first point is ineligible to earn the second point, with the following exceptions:

· A response which has a presentation error in the integrand (for example, mismatched or missing parentheses, misplaced exponent) does not earn the first point but would earn the second point for the correct answer. A response which has a presentation error in the integrand and which reports an incorrect answer earns no points.

· A response that presents an integrand of ( ln( x+3 )− x 4 +2 x 3 ) 2 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48A1@

If the first time the response presents f( x )−g(x) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD4@ as j( x )=ln( x+3 )− x 4 +2 x 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4779@ occurs in part (c), the response loses a point. If the response already lost a point for this error in part (a) or part (b), then the response is eligible for all remaining points for a correct or consistent answer.

In part (c), the consistent answer using j( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39A9@ is 252.187 252.187 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DF8@ (or 252.188 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DF9@ ).

A response that uses incorrect limits is only eligible for the second point, provided the limits are imported from part (a) in Case 1 or Case 2. In both of these situations, the second point is earned only for answers consistent with the imported limits.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point may be earned by presenting dA dx  ⋅  dx dt ,    A ′  ⋅  dx dt ,    A ′  ( x ) ⋅  dx dt ,    A ′  ( x ) ⋅  x ′ ,    A ′  ( − 0.5 ) ⋅ 7, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@8EBF@
or k ⋅ 7, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40F0@ where k is a declared value of A ′  ( − 0.5 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4241@ or any equivalent expression, including 2( f ( x )−g ( x ) )( f ′  ( x )− g ′  ( x ) ) dx dt . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@574F@

If a response defines f ( x )−g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43EE@ as a function in parts (b) or (c) (for example,
h ( x )=f ( x )−g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@49F8@ ), then a correct expression for dA dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C9D@ (for example, 2h dh dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E6D@ ) earns the first point.

A response that imports a function A ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD9@ declared in part (c) is eligible for both points (the answer must be consistent with the imported function A ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD9@ ).

A response that presents an incorrect function for A ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD9@ that is not imported from part (c) is eligible only for the first point.

Except when A ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD9@ is imported from part (c), the second point is earned only for the correct answer.

A response that does not earn the first point is ineligible to earn the second point except in the special case noted below.

· If the first time the response presents f( x )−g(x) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD4@ as j( x )=ln( x+3 )− x 4 +2 x 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4779@ occurs in part (d), the response loses a point. If the response already lost a point for this error in part (a), part (b), or part (c), then the response is eligible for all remaining points for a correct or consistent answer. In part (d) the consistent answer using j( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39A9@ is 20.287. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E34@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.
